group_1.textRight: Wow, I haven't had your cooking in forever!

group_1.textLeft: It's nothing worth getting excited for, though.
Why, it's just French toast.

group_1.textRight: Oh yeah, Yachiyo made that the other day, too.

group_1.textLeft: R-really?!
I should have planned something else...
I had assumed Miss Nanami served typical@Japanese dishes,
so I thought something Western@would be nice...

group_1.textRight: Don't worry about it!
I'm excited to get to see the difference@between your cooking styles!

group_1.textLeft: That makes me feel better.

group_1.textRight: Here, Dad, I made you some coffee.

group_1.textLeft: Thanks, Iroha.
Huh, this is drip brew, not instant, right?

group_1.textRight: Yeah. At Yachiyo's house, we often drink tea,
and I make coffee sometimes, too.

group_1.textLeft: I see.
You've done a lot of growing up@while we've been away.

group_1.textRight: But it all comes down to the flavor!@How does it taste?

group_1.textLeft: ...It's delicious.

group_1.textRight: Wonderful! Looks like I've been growing up@after all.

group_1.textLeft: How was it, Ui?
Any differences between our French toasts?

group_1.textRight: Yeah.
Yachiyo's is more tender and soft,
while yours is still crispy even after being@soaked in syrup,
and I think it's a little less sweet.

group_1.textLeft: And whose do you prefer?

group_1.textRight: Hmm...I think I like both?

group_1.textLeft: *Giggle* Sorry, I shouldn't have put you@on the spot like that!
I'd really like to take you guys abroad@with us next time,
but you've grown much more stubborn@than you used to be, Iroha...

group_1.textRight: Sorry.
But there's no need to worry.
We'll keep growing up well at Yachiyo's house.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, Yachiyo has been doing an excellent job,@so there's nothing to be concerned about.
You're also able to study much more with her@than you could with us.
Living abroad offers different experiences@than living with others,
but there's no difference in the amount@of time you spend.
If it's good enough for you, Iroha,@then it's good enough for me.

group_1.textRight: Thanks, Dad.

group_1.textLeft: And speaking of Yachiyo, I heard you and Ui@will be having a picnic with your friends.

group_1.textRight: That's right, we are.
We're going to cook for it right now!

group_1.textLeft: And you'll be using those die-cutters we bought@yesterday to help arrange the food?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, I think we are!
We'll make everyone's lunches look really cute.

group_1.textLeft: Well, use this too while you're at it.
It's some extra allowance.

group_1.textRight: Oh, you really don't need to...@Are you sure...?

group_1.textLeft: Consider it our gift to everyone at Mikazuki.
It's my way of giving them thanks for their@hospitality, so use it to have fun with everyone.

group_1.textRight: Thank you, Dad.

group_1.textLeft: Meanwhile, I'll help you guys cook.

group_1.textRight: Oh no, that's okay!@We want to make this ourselves.

group_1.textLeft: Ah, alright.
Oh dear, it's hard to watch them growing up...
